alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 20 at 1:23PM PDT until March 21 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 50 to 60 mph expected. For the Wind Advisory, southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 10 AM to 10 PM PDT Tuesday. For the Wind Advisory, until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Very difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects will become airborne. Moderate tree and minor structural damage possible.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
